content: German Bundesliga Season 22/23(A self-moderated discussion and prediction thread)Since the old Bundesliga thread has unfortunately turned into a mega spam-fest where reasonable discussions or chats are almost impossible, I took the chance to open another self-moderated thread.This thread is supposed to be about the following topics:1. Casual discussions about the Bundesliga and its clubs2. Betting & tips on individual Bundesliga matches and/or parlays3. Transfer rumours about Bundesliga players and coachesTo prevent this thread from ending up in a spam-fest as well, there will be some clear rules. This means that posts that do not comply with the rules (especially generic shitposts for signature campaigns) will be consequently deleted. In this thread the discussion should be in the spotlight, so please only post if you are really interested in the Bundesliga - otherwise please check out the spamthreads.Thread rules & guidelines:1. No off-topic2. No pyramid quotes (if you're quoting more than three people your post will be deleted. Use ~ or -snip- for longer quotes.)3. No posts of generic quality (shitposts)4. No defamation5. No trolling6. Good posts will be rewarded by me. So give your post some thought and get some merit.

comments.author: bullrun2024bro
comments.body: Tonight we continue with the 17th matchday of the Bundesliga and the following matches are scheduled:Source: Google, Bundesliga Spieltag 17On paper, it should be two easy wins for RB Leipzig and FC Bayern today. But at Bayern in particular, it's hardly been about football in recent days, but rather about the tiresome goalkeeper discussion, which peaked yesterday with the sacking of goalkeeper coach Toni Tapalović. As a reason, irreconcilable differences with the rest of the coaching team were cited by the media. If you ask me, a very unfortunate end for a co-trainer who had been working with Bayern (and Manuel Neuer ofc) since 2011.But perhaps now is exactly the right time for the team to finally get back to normal and focus fully on the games in the second half of the season (Neuer is injured anyway until the end of the season, why are we having this goalkeeper discussion at all?). I mean there are tough opponents waiting in the Champions League - you simply can't afford discussions off the pitch tbh.And concerning the Leipzig game: Probably a 5:0 or something? Pretty, pretty sure Schalke getting smashed today.
